job_description: JOB DESCRIPTIONThe Green Timbers Heritage Society is hiring Habitat Restoration Team Leaders and Members for the Surrey Natural Areas Partnership (SNAP) summer program.  The SNAP program is a unique partnership involving three local non-profit groups and Surrey Parks, Recreation  Culture.  The goals of the program are to: 1) restore and enhance Surreyâ€™s natural area parks; 2) provide environmental education to the community; 3) encourage the public to become stewards of natural areas; and 4) raise awareness and promote the care of boulevard trees.  Through this program, the successful applicants will receive training and experience in environmental restoration and habitat enhancement techniques.  The Habitat Restoration Team Leaders will lead a team of Habitat Restoration Team Members, and will work under the direction of the SNAP Coordinator to implement restoration prescriptions in Surrey parks. This is a field based position.DutiesLeaders: Lead a team to implement restoration prescriptions (e.g. removal of invasive plant species, park clean-ups, small fauna projects, trail closures, planting maintenance), assist with the training of Habitat Restoration Team MembersContribute to a positive work environmentEnsure work is completed in a safe and efficient mannerAssist with training and supervision of volunteersMaintain accurate daily records and complete a final reportCommunicate with the public and park neighbours in relation to restoration and enhancement projects, as well as appropriate park use and impacts on the environmentOccasionally assist other SNAP teams with staffing environmental displays at special events, leading community stewardship events, and other educational outreach activities
